flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: This guide will teach you how to build your own 1920s Cathedral Radio (With a Twist). It features a FM radio,and iPod connect-ability. Plus, the included Color Organ (Collin Cunningham's Design) will let you rock out to your favorite tunes even harder, whether on your iPod, or the radio.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This guide will teach you how to build your own 1920s Cathedral Radio (With a Twist). It features a FM radio,and iPod connect-ability. Plus, the included Color Organ (Collin Cunningham's Design) will let you rock out to your favorite tunes even harder, whether on your iPod, or the radio.

Relevant parts
  • Wood Glue or Epoxy
  • Cloth
  • 1/2x1/2 Pine Wood
  • 9 Volt alkaline battery
  • 9 volt battery snap connector
  • Small Feet (For Furniture)
  • See Parts List (Named Radio-New1) (PDF Document)
Tools
  • Helping hands
  • Soldering Iron and rosin core solder.

lines.text: THEY ARE LISTED IN THE PARTS LIST
lines.text_raw: THEY ARE LISTED IN THE PARTS LIST

guide.summary: A retro 1920s desktop cathedral radio whith a twist. It includes an FM radio, color organ (many thanks to Collin Cunningham), and the ability to connect your iPod.
guide.title: Retro 1920s Cathedral Radio (With a Twist)

tools.text: Soldering Iron and rosin core solder.
